titleStmt.title: J. H. Myers et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5705

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned were members of the Jury that tried David Schroeder who was convicted of cutting, and stabbing Andrew Doran at the ^late^ May term of the Jefferson Circuit Court, and we respectfully ask you to grant him a pardon.

J, H, Myers
A. A. Quarrier
John Price
James, M, Grove
Jacob S. Augustus
W. D. Smith
The names signed to this petition, are those a portion of those The Jury that tried the petitioner and I understand have signed this petition without reluctance.

W. G. Reasor
Geo. W. Johnston
Phil. Tomppert Jr.

Pardon granted
Sept 14th 1864
Tho E Bramlette

Jefferson Cir C
vs
D. Shroeder
Pardoned
15th Sept/64
Chas A. Smith
Box 346
